# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's a simple function `wrap_string` that should do the trick:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line = current_line * (isempty(current_line) ? "" : " ") * word
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

You can use it like this:

```julia
text = "This is a test of the emergency broadcast system. This is only a test."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output:

```
This is a test
of the emergency
broadcast system.
This is only a test.
```
